meanings.definition: Sensitive to all colors except red.
meanings.sent1: The orthochromatic film captured vibrant hues without the need for red tones.
meanings.sent2: The artist preferred using orthochromatic materials to create vivid images.
meanings.sent3: The orthochromatic camera was so picky, it refused to see anything red!
meanings.sent4: Her orthochromatic vision allowed her to see the world in a unique way, devoid of red.
meanings.sent5: The orthochromatic filter made the colors pop in the photograph.

meanings.definition: A photographic emulsion that is sensitive to all colors except red.
meanings.sent1: The photographer loaded the camera with orthochromatic for the shoot.
meanings.sent2: The orthochromatic produced stunning black and white images.
meanings.sent3: The orthochromatic emulsion seemed to have a grudge against the color red.
meanings.sent4: The orthochromatic film was like a detective, revealing all colors except red.
meanings.sent5: Using orthochromatic film gave the photos a classic, timeless look.

meanings.definition: A type of film that is sensitive to all colors except red.
meanings.sent1: The filmmaker chose orthochromatic for its unique color sensitivity.
meanings.sent2: The orthochromatic film stock was perfect for capturing a vintage feel.
meanings.sent3: The orthochromatic film was like a picky eater, avoiding anything red.
meanings.sent4: The orthochromatic film saw the world in a different light, excluding red hues.
meanings.sent5: The orthochromatic film added depth and richness to the movie scenes.
